I will now take the time to explain something to the general public (which is made up of far too many closed minded sheep)

Michael Jackson is one of the biggest sellling musicians of all time. He was a perfectionist with an extremely high level oftalent. He was a pioneer in the industry. First and foremost, he deserves your respect for that and that alone.

On top of this, consider that his fame was created by the YOU(the general public), his subsequent isolation was created by YOU. It was not safe for him to walk the streets and live any kind of normal life once he reached the age of 12. Many many years before he was accused of molestation we decided that he was such a good musician that he had to be locked away.

Now, an ignorant person of the general public (sooo many) will blame him for what he did or didn't do OVER A DECADE AGO, ON ONE CLAIMED OCCASION. But this isn't at all fair. You have not been locked away from people for decades at a time. You live your pampered lives where you are allowed to do what you want, when you want. UNTIL YOU GAINED A GRASP OF EXACTLY WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE COMPLETELY ISOLATED, DON"T JUDGE HIM FOR HIS "CRIMES".Just show him some respect for what he was able to achieve musically and for what he was able to give to the world before YOU payed to have him murdered by love and adoration.

Start seeing him for who he was, and what he has given you, and for Christ sake stop being so Goddamn ignorant and closed minded. Im talking to you (racists, hicks, white sepremacists, those jealous of others doing well in their life, those stuck up people who are blinded by a hatred for people who wrong kids in any way shape or form) All of you; Your life is one great big fallacy. 

If we are going to evolve as a species we have to consider that he did nothing wrong until there is evidence to disprove our thoughts. I am not letting him off the hook, but I am a rational enough thinker that I am not going to come to conclustions that aren't backed up by facts. The testimony of a child that has everything to gain from accusing Michael of these things is just rediculous.

Michaels only true and factual crime was in trusting people too much. Unfortunately, that too got him killed.

Just become better people and start thinking critically and for yourselves is all I ask. You may be able to get a real job if you do (who knows).

Geez Louise!! Can you two knock it off and take this discussion to the forums instead? 

Makes me sick when people use the torrent page to discuss stuff like this instead of of video/audio quality of the movie itself. 

Since we're already on the subject:

I like Jimi Hendrix and Michael Jackson. 

@MJ_is_dead: I'm pretty sure that you know Hendrix died of a heroin overdose but does that make us remember him as a junkie and overlook his music? No. You are a fan of his music and are able to look past his faults to appreciate that.
He used LSD,meth and alcohol and was also involved in violent incidents where he beat on of his girlfriends with a phone receiver and another with a bottle because he thought they were cheating on him. 
Beyond that and his other faults he was a great musician with many achievements and innovations. 

Michael Jackson's problem was that he was almost like a child himself. No one could say no to him, and if the did they were promptly fired and replaced with someone who did his bidding. He was out of touch with reality since he had been famous at a very young age and didn't have many of the experiences that we have growing up.  

The molestation charges, to me, have always sounded made up. The father of the first boy was  recorded saying he did not care what about his sons' well-being. He wanted MJ to pay up or he would destroy his career. Sure sounds like a really concerned parent who wants justice, doesn't it?
In the second case the mother continually got defensive over little details and wouldn't give direct answers. Much of her behavior was that of someone with moderate to severe mental issues.  The father testified that she had allegedly been in a mental institution and that she was very controlling of her kids to make them do or say whatever she asked. Oh yeah, she was also convicted of welfare fraud. 

Enough. Overall I think I will enjoy this flick, maybe not. Please take your debate elsewhere

Correction: Yes, I am admitting I fouled up about Hendrix's death. It has never been clear but the official story is he took several sleeping pills that were a lot stronger than he knew of when he should only have taken half of one.
